text: Argentina competed at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships in Gwangju, South Korea from 12 to 28 July. ==Artistic swimming== Argentina's artistic swimming team consisted of 2 athletes (2 female). ;Women {|class=wikitable style="font- size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Preliminaries !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Points !Rank !Points !Rank |-align=center |align=left|Trinidad López |align=left|Solo technical routine |68.0890 |26 |colspan=2|Did not advance |-align=center |align=left|Camila Arregui |align=left|Solo free routine |74.6333 |25 |colspan=2|Did not advance |-align=center |align=left rowspan=2|Camila Arregui Trinidad López |align=left|Duet technical routine |75.5435 |30 |colspan=2|Did not advance |-align=center |align=left|Duet free routine |75.9333 |29 |colspan=2|Did not advance |} ==Open water swimming== Argentina qualified two male and one female open water swimmers. ;Men {|class=wikitable style="font- size:90%;" |- !Athlete !Event !Time !Rank |-align=center |align=left|Santiago Arteta |align=left rowspan=2|Men's 10 km |1:50:24.1 |40 |-align=center |align=left|Joaquin Moreno |1:51:45.7 |46 |} ;Women {|class=wikitable style="font-size:90%;" |- !Athlete !Event !Time !Rank |-align=center |align=left rowspan=2|Julia Arino |align=left|Women's 5 km |58:17.9 |26 |-align=center |align=left|Women's 10 km |1:56:32.2 |32 |} ==Swimming== Argentina has entered three swimmers. ;Men {| class="wikitable" style="text- align:center;
